data.title: AFC Asian Cup 2023-2024 referees and match officials list, schedule, date, time table and fixtures
data.meta_description: In order to uphold the highest standards of match officiating, the AFC Asian Cup 2023 has introduced new roles with the referees list out.
data.text:
We examine the referees list, full schedule, & streaming information from the 2023 AFC Asian Cup, which will take place in Qatar from 10th January

The AFC Asian Cup Qatar 2023, the primary competition of the Asian Football Confederation, is set to kick off on January 10th, 2024. This 18th edition of the tournament features an unprecedented team of 74 match officials, making it the largest assembly in the history of this continental showcase.

AFC Asian Cup 2023-2024 referees and match officials list, schedule, date, time table, teams and fixtures

Advertisement

2023 AFC Asian Cup schedule, date, venue, matches, & officials list

Out of the 18 member Associations, they’ve chosen a collective of 35 referees and 39 assistant referees. Their selection criteria hinge on technical proficiency, adept game management, physical fitness, and prior performance in high-level continental and international football competitions.

This tournament will witness a historic moment with the full introduction of the Video Assistant Referee (VAR) system, making its debut in this 18th installment. It’s worth noting that VAR was successfully integrated from the quarter-final stage during the previous edition held in the United Arab Emirates. In order to uphold the highest standards of match officiating, the AFC Asian Cup 2023 has introduced new roles such as Video Match Officials and expanded existing ones.

Among the list of match officials, notable figures include seasoned male officials Abdulrahman Al-Jassim of Qatar, who officiated the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 third-place game between Croatia and Morocco, and Alireza Faghani, who will be officiating in his third AFC Asian Cup.

Advertisement

When And Where to Watch: live streaming & telecast

In China, viewers tune in to IQIYI Sports and CCTV to catch the live action of the 2023 AFC Asian Cup. Meanwhile, Triller TV will be the go-to platform for fans in France. German sports enthusiasts prefer Sportdigital, while in India, Sports18 is the platform of choice. Japanese viewers can access the tournament’s matches through DAZN, and in the United Kingdom, Triller TV will also be broadcasting the event. Paramount+ and CBS Sports will cater to fans in the United States.
